item.title: Pok√©mon Legends: Z-A Has A Terrifying Death Trap Fans Keep Warning Others To Avoid
item.content:encoded:
Throughout Pok√©mon Legends: Z-A, the citizens of Lumiose City worry about the potential consequences of having wild monsters living alongside humans, with the monsters in designated Wild Zones. What if a powerful Pok√©mon escapes these fenced-in areas and wreaks havoc on the populace? That‚Äôs a perfectly valid fear, actually, because fans have become so scared of one of these zones that they‚Äôre warning other players not to go in there without a powerful water Pok√©mon on their team. I‚Äôm talking about Wild Zone 17, and its literal lion‚Äôs den full of Pyroars.

This small area was once a simple park, and now that Lumiose City has made it a Wild Zone, untamed Pok√©mon roam it. The local Diggersby is making tunnels in its earth. Skarmory flies over the area. When you go there after the sun goes down, you might find a Lampent‚Äôs flame lighting up the night. Those are pretty manageable, however. What‚Äôs got players spooked is that an entire pride of Pyroar hangs out in the upper area. As best as I can tell after repeated trips to Wild Zone 17, the spawn is fixed to have one Alpha-sized male Pyroar and several regular-sized female ones. If even one of these fire-breathing lions sees you, the entire pack is going to pounce on you before you can even throw a Pok√© Ball. These felines seem to target the player‚Äôs trainer character almost exclusively, and after a few attacks, you‚Äôll get knocked out and sent back to where the humans roam. They‚Äôre territorial, powerful, and can overwhelm you quickly. The experience of getting your shit rocked by these Pyroars has become such an infamous skill check while trying to complete the Pok√©dex that fans are posting their Ls online and turning Wild Zone 17 into a new meme like it‚Äôs the Pok√©mon equivalent of the Shadow Realm.

help pic.twitter.com/Pdfy2MwVA1

‚Äî üå∑Theaüå∑ (@Flak0ps) October 21, 2025

earth powering you pic.twitter.com/YVqkVONy2r

‚Äî HT1 8Ô∏è‚É£‚ñ∂Ô∏èüçâ (@BrocTaeshi4ever) October 22, 2025

Enter wild zone 17

‚Äî Pyroar (@DittoImposter) October 22, 2025

wild zone 17 piss me the fuck off so i caught this guys whole pride. fuck you pic.twitter.com/5v6wrK6TMW

‚Äî Bubbly Mar üè≥Ô∏è‚Äç‚ößÔ∏è ü¶ä (@bubblymarmar) October 25, 2025

Wild Zone 17 pic.twitter.com/MNW5GgmYjt

‚Äî TheKingVillager (@TheKingVillager) October 18, 2025

hey. hey come to wild zone 17. we promise we wont jump you dawg we got skarmory and chespin here its all cool we dont even know earth power #pyroar #pokemon #PokemonLegendsZA pic.twitter.com/0MxYw3LSto

‚Äî Art honse (@CrypticKelpie) October 21, 2025

Trying to catch fucking Skarmory with the pack of lions trying mauling you

‚Äî AlfLandonFan (@AlfLandonFan36) October 19, 2025

Wild Zone 17 in Z-A has proven to me that a billion lions might actually win

‚Äî Solosis (@Solosis0o0) October 22, 2025

The Most Difficult parts of Pok√©mon:

1. Volo & Giratina
2. Ultra Necrozma
3. Cynthia
4. Wild Zone 17

‚Äî Mizuki üí´ (@MizukiAlola) October 21, 2025

Average Wild Zone 17 experience: https://t.co/YWCiL2lCXi pic.twitter.com/awaY7vYu6Z

‚Äî Mizuki üí´ (@MizukiAlola) October 21, 2025

I‚Äôm in the post-game now and cleaning up side quests, and a surprising amount of them have put me in Wild Zone 17. Luckily, I have Mega Starmie, which makes up for its ridiculous appearance with massive Surf attacks that take out several of these lions at once. Arceus be with you, fellow trainers. You‚Äôd better have Burn Heal.

item.title: The PS2 Turns 25 Years Old And Here Are Its Best-Selling Games
item.content:encoded:
Sony‚Äôs PlayStation 2 turned 25 years old this week. I‚Äôm sorry if you suddenly feel very old. But don‚Äôt worry, I feel old, too! Anyway, to celebrate the milestone, Circana senior director Mat Piscatella shared some data about the console, including its best-selling games as well as the home console‚Äôs most-purchased accessory.

On October 26, 2000, Sony launched the PS2 in North America, and it quickly became one of the most successful video game console releases in history. In the United States alone, the console would go on to sell over 45 million units, and globally it has shipped 160 million, making it the best-selling console ever. (Though the Nintendo Switch will likely overtake it in the near future.) Over the course of the console‚Äôs lifecycle, thousands of PlayStation 2 games were released for it. Not all of them were great, but the machine does still indeed boast one of the best console game libraries around.

To celebrate the console‚Äôs 25th birthday in America, Piscatella posted some fun stats about the PS2 on social media. Did you know that the 8mb memory card was the PS2‚Äôs most sold accessory with a 61-percent attach rate? Overall, 147 million accessories were sold in the United States for the PS2. Wowza. And for those curious, here are the top 20 best-selling PlayStation 2 games of all time based on unit sales.

US Top 20 All-Time Best-Selling PS2 Games (Jan 1999 ‚Äì Sep 2025) 

  1. Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas
  2. Grand Theft Auto: Vice City
  3. Grand Theft Auto III 
  4. Guitar Hero III: Legends of Rock
  5. Gran Turismo 3: A-Spec
  6. Madden NFL 2005
  7. Guitar Hero II 
  8. Madden NFL 2004
  9. Kingdom Hearts
  10. Madden NFL 2006
  11. Madden NFL 2007
  12. Jampack Series: PlayStation 2
  13. Madden NFL 2003
  14. Need for Speed: Underground 
  15. Star Wars: Battlefront II
  16. Midnight Club 3: DUB Edition
  17. Final Fantasy X
  18. Gran Turismo 4: The Real Driving Simulator
  19. God of War
  20. Medal of Honor: Frontline

While I expected the GTA games to top the chart, I was surprised to see Medal of Honor: Frontline, Final Fantasy X, and God of War crack the list, too. Also, wow, EA really was a force to be reckoned with back then, huh? What a different time for video games. Then again, GTA leading the pack hasn‚Äôt changed much in 2025, so I guess the more things change‚Ä¶



https://kotaku.com/best-selling-ps2-games-madden-gta-guitar-hero-25-year-anniversary-2000639307

item.title: Costco‚Äôs 1-Year Membership Now Comes With a Digital Shop Card That Almost Covers the Cost, Making It Basically Free
item.content:encoded:
When you get invited to an exclusive event, usually you‚Äôre the one who‚Äôs expected to come bearing gifts. But with Costco‚Äôs invitation to join their Gold Star club for just $65, which gets you a year of access to incredible savings across all of their huge array of departments, you‚Äôre the one receiving the gift in the form of a $40 gift card. The invitation is waiting for you now at StackSocial. 

If your one-stop shopping ambitions are even greater, so are the rewards. StackSocial is offering a year‚Äôs membership to Costco‚Äôs Executive Gold Star club, where you get all of the access and benefits of Gold Star membership plus a 2% annual reward on all of your purchases, for just $130. That one comes with a $60 gift card, so you get nearly half of your membership fee back instantly.

See Costco Gold Star at StackSocial

See Costco Executive Gold Star at Stacksocial

Members Only

A membership is the only way to get in the door at any of Costco‚Äôs 635 locations nationwide, but when the membership fee is marked down so significantly and delivered with a gift card to be used on your first shopping trip, it‚Äôs more than worth it. Whether you go in person or shop online, Costco is the ultimate in one-stop shopping, with everything from fresh groceries, meat, and fish to clothes for men, women, and kids, with literally hundreds of other goods and services in between.

A trip to Costco can replace your trips to the grocery store, big-box electronics store, hardware store, bakery, liquor store, drugstore, and more. Then, of course, there is the legendary Costco food court, where the $1.50 all-beef hot dog and 20 oz drink deal has not changed price in years. And before you gas up the car for your Costco trip, remember that Costco membership also gets you access to the dramatically reduced gas prices at Costco‚Äôs own pumps.

More Than Merchandise

Costco‚Äôs deals on merchandise and groceries are amazing, but so are their deals on services you wouldn‚Äôt normally associate with a shopping run. Costco‚Äôs automotive department has outstanding deals on tires and other services that are performed on-site, and there are also optometry and prescription departments ready to provide important personal health services at lower prices. Travel deals, check printing, free roadside assistance, auto insurance, water delivery ‚Äî it‚Äôs no exaggeration to say that Costco has virtually any and everything you can think of.

But the only way to get in on all of these goods and services at fantastic prices is by having a membership. StackSocial‚Äôs deals for new members on a year of Gold Star membership for $65 or a year of Executive Gold Star membership for $130 await, as do the $40 (Gold Star) or $65 (Executive Gold Star) gift cards that automatically recoup much your first year‚Äôs fee.

See Costco Gold Star at StackSocial

See Costco Executive Gold Star at Stacksocial



https://kotaku.com/costcos-1-year-membership-now-comes-with-a-digital-shop-card-that-almost-covers-the-cost-making-it-basically-free-2000639092

item.title: Halo Gets Sucked Into ICE‚Äôs Recruitment Meme War
item.content:encoded:
Last time that the Department of Homeland Security used a video game property to try and recruit people to ICE, it was with a Pok√©mon video in which they said they were going to ‚Äúcatch‚Äù undocumented people while the original anime‚Äôs theme song played over footage of ICE agents invading homes and arresting people. The Pok√©mon Company didn‚Äôt do anything about it, so I guess whoever‚Äôs on the DHS‚Äô social accounts is feeling brave enough to keep using video game imagery to try and promote ICE and recruit people to its cause, because it‚Äôs now using Halo imagery and language days after Halo Studios announced the original game is being remade and ported to PlayStation.

Finishing this fight. pic.twitter.com/6Ezq9NUqMq

‚Äî Homeland Security (@DHSgov) October 27, 2025

The post on the DHS‚Äô X account has an image of Halo characters on a Warthog with the subtitle ‚ÄúFinishing this fight,‚Äù a reference to the line from Halo 2 in which protagonist Master Chief says he‚Äôs ‚Äúfinishing this fight‚Äù with the Covenant by blowing up their ship at the end of the sequel. The image itself has the text ‚ÄúDestroy the Flood,‚Äù which refers to a parasitic alien species that Master Chief and his friends fight throughout the series, just above a link to the ICE recruitment website. The rhetoric is not subtle.

The replies are full of the same memetic bullshit you often see on such posts that shows some people view uprooting other people‚Äôs lives (or worse) as something to cheer for and encourage the way you might celebrate a sports team‚Äôs championship win. The broader context of the Trump Administration using Xbox and Microsoft‚Äôs imagery for a stupid recruitment ad, however, shows the rot runs much deeper. Notably, Microsoft has donated to Trump and his causes during his presidency, including the ongoing demolition of the White House‚Äôs East Wing and his inauguration fund, likely to garner his support on issues like artificial intelligence. That‚Äôs not entirely surprising given the company‚Äôs political history, as Microsoft has reportedly made efforts to erase its own diversity initiatives and inadequately responded to right-wing attacks on reproductive rights in the eyes of some of its workers. 

The Halo post from DHS came just hours after GameStop and the Trump Administration went back and forth with console war memes that also used Halo characters. We‚Äôve reached out to Microsoft and Halo Studios for comment and will update this story if we hear back.



https://kotaku.com/department-homeland-security-halo-ice-pokemon-video-dhs-2000639308
